text: hi I'm nyala Murray and I'm 17 years old
and I'm from the Bronx New York I am
totally blind I was born with
retinopathy of prematurity and I'm in a
litter because I have mild cerebral
palsy such as people think because I'm
in a wheelchair and I'm learned that I
have a mental disability also but I'm
normal I'm just like everybody else I'd
go to school I go outside I chill with
my friends I hang out wagon road is a
camp that deals with developmentally and
disabled children you do eyes and cross
cooking in the summer you do horseback
riding and swimming becoming an
assistant counselor for the care for the
summer day camp I was a bit nervous at
first because of me being in a
wheelchair and I didn't know how the
kids would react to all she's a leader
she's in a wheelchair my group was it so
11 years old they had questions about
what did it feel like to be in a
wheelchair or how is it to go around and
people having to look at you sometimes
there I'll tell them it doesn't matter
what what you are who you are it's what
you make of it if you don't have
confidence in yourself nobody else is
going to have confidence in you
